intro: Chytraculia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican chytraculia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
